reviews.review: I really love this game, always full of bugs... but really adictive xd

Great game, I like this game because it's a different take on many games out right now, there are constant balances with perks between killer v survivor, but the game is definately playable, and it does have a learning curve (invest time into perks and your survivors and you will see yourself become a better killer or survivor), I've played this game so long that I have legacy skins; I've been rank 20 (lowest rank you can be), and I've been rank 1, 

my ONLY complaint about DBD, is probably... "if you invest in being a rank 1 killer or survivor there is no benefit to do so" "games sometimes reward you post-season for your accolades / achievements, and I'm left uninspired to continue playing to maintain my lower rank status" - the game is still fun, both as a solo player and playing with friends.

games not for everyone.

For new players you will be at a disadvantage, however, once you grind your way up its fun.

Even after months of playing some killers still manage to make me scream haha.
zu viele hacker und inkompetente team mates

O jogo para quem √© inciante, √© divertido. Rende bons sustos. Depois de se familiarizar com o game, Dead by Daylight passa de longe do g√™nero horror. √â apenas um jogo de gato e rato onde o rato recebe bufffs e o gato nerfs. A comunidade √© t√≥xica ao extremo e o sistema de report que Behavior disponibiliza n√£o funciona e n√£o h√° feedback do mesmo (sugiro n√£o ler o chat p√≥s-partida). Por√©m eu ainda recomendo o jogo.

"Sometimes when I play this bug, we find a few games."

While I completely recommend this game, I will start off with the negatives. The biggest one is that the game is constantly full of bugs. Mostly minor ones like small graphics glitches (I can see inside my arm), or certain actions not going through (press the button and nothing happens). Occassionally they are more difficult ones, people falling out of the game, etc. It's not too bad, learning to play around the bugs, then relearning when they fix the old bugs and you get new ones. But certainly not recommended for anyone who gets easily frustrated by bugs and such.

The community is a mix of wonderful and toxic, on both ends. Salty survivors and killers who break the game (and often both are to their own detriment). The post game chat gets a lot of salt, but I feel it can vary. There are some frustrating killers/survivors, but also those who are genuinely good and really just want feedback. I've made a few friends this way, and often find that it's overwhelmingly neutral or somewhat positive. But for those who are easily upset by toxic communities, again, this game may not be for you.

Finally, there's the difficulty in balancing the community. Nerf killers, and they're upset. Nerf survivors and the survivors are upset. It's a dififcult balance to make both sides happy, especially in the very low or very high tiered ranks.

But, there's still a lot of good. If you adjust to the bugs, the game play is enjoyable, and surprisingly not repetitive. Each map is procedurally generated, and each game seems to vary greatly. Survive with friends is a fun mode, as well. I find it more fun to play with friends in the matches, which helps counter a lot of the frustrations mentioned earlier. Also, it's interesting to have to balance what game play you want in each match. Some matches punish you for being altruistic, while others tend to make it harder to play without saving the other survivors. With all the factors that go into each match, it feels like a brand new game each time you play.

Overall, don't take it too seriously. I'm, at best, average at the game, and really it's just that- a game, which is meant to be enjoyed. Nothing is truly going to change if you're rank 1 or rank 20. So, yes, I do recommmend it, but again take the whole game with a grain of salt, and don't play too seriously, and you'll enjoy it a lot more.
This is the most stupid fucking game ive ever played

I personally find this game to be one of the most enjoyable options out on the market. The asymmetrical playstyle is very very fun and never gets stale as the game is constantly being updated with new features which allow all players to stay on their toes. It's fun with friends and is a good strategy game. 10/10 would recommend.

One of my favourite games I've ever played. 
Dead By Daylight is a 4 vs 1 Horror game where survivors face a killer, each using a series of perks to give them the edge.
When I began to play this game it was very casually, a couple of games in a wekk here or there and then, suddenly, I was hooked. From out of nowhere I wanted to keep playing and playing, finding ways to improve and survive more games.
Many people may say the game is in a bad state, personally I think the game is healthier than ever, with new content and updates coming regularly and online communities available, this game truly is thriving
Wow, I love this game, would reccomend to any person on the planet, I was eating my cat while playing a match and I learned how to play the game. Very cool Kanye

While i have very little time shown on my profile, i have played this game A LOT from other mediums. There is only one problem that i truly see that impedes the game from beginning to end, and it isnt the pallet looping or the survivors dictating the match (even though that is a glaring problem), its the attitude for survivors. after just ONE game as killer i was already called a "tunneler", a "camper", and an idiot, even though killed all 4 of them as hillbilly with only 2 gens finished. this isnt a one off problem either, it happens seemingly every game. Yes the game is rough around the edges, but its so much fucking fun even if you lose as killer, and sadly its depressing as you watch a humans intelligance melt away as they moan about losing. Dont buy this game if you are flustered easily by bullshittery and retardation, because there is a lot of it here, but if you dont care about other peoples feelings, and you want to still play this great game, then id highly recommend it!

i love trhis game, its a great community, along with excelent ervers.
pros; lots of gameplay value, great community, competitve, many rank systems and daily challenges

cons; the dekux dosnt really have any benift because you dont get any dlc, not really worth the extra money
the game kinda feels like the dlc is needed, and perk mecaicsa dont work as well as they should along with game mecanics I.E nerfs and buffs,  change every update making the game have either too OP killers or too op surviors

The game is fun except every match I get in I either lose connection or get tunneled by the killer and to make it worse even if i survive I seem to lose all my blood points from the match as a surviver I don't have that issue as a Killer it just takes way to long to find a match as a killer or when I do get a match people rage quit on their first hook
great buffed hacker killer game. nice job. yes, we need more buff for wallhacking killers.

It's worth buying!

I really enjoy playing this game on both survivor and killer side. And i played both all the way to rank one so i know what i'm talking about. It's being updated a lot, the Devs are working continuously to improve both the games mechanic and the balance, plus adding additional content, that you dont even have to pay for. (you can unlock dlc characters by simply playing the game).
Most of the recent negative reviews seem to be toxic, so if you wanna try the game out I can tell you it is a lot of fun.

The balance now is the fairest of all time. The game came from a heavy disadvantage towards the killer. The survivors were definately to strong. Most of the latest reviews are in my point of view about the survivors being nerfed, so that the killer has actually chances to get them. I find it annoying and childish that they toss out negative reviews in order to present the devs in a bad light, instead of giving constructive feedback in their forum.

Did you ever consider, that the killer is balanced when he receives two kills on average?
